dialogues.text: Reverend Scott is conducting the ship's religious service CC The ship's Chaplain sits to one side, somewhat anxious . congregation we find Susan, Robin, Mr. Martin, and some Scott looks around at the faces. He speaks easily, but hi grows during the sermon.

dialogues.speaker: LL
dialogues.text: ScoTrtT You know, God's pretty busy. He's got a long-term plan for humanity that stretches far beyond our comprehension. So it's not reasonable to expect Him to concern Himself only with the individual. The individual is important only to the extent that he’s a creative link between the past and the future -- in his children, or in the contribution he makes to humanity. Oh, that doesn't mean that God has forgotten us. On the contrary he's given to each . and every one of us a great and infinite gift ~- a part of Himself -- a.spark from His eternal fire to be nurtured within us -- to keep us warm, to strengthen our efforts. ) Therefore, don't pray to God to solve your problems -- pray to that part of God within cai you. Have the guts to fight for yourself.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: (continuing) God wants brave souls. He wants winners, not quitters. If you can't win, you can at least try to win. God loves triers. (smiles at Robin and Susan) Right, Robin? -- Susan? They nod, smiling back -~
